Deep Teal Headings - White Content

  • Adjust
  • Identify
  • Determine

Adjust

Image by Dmitry Demidov under Pexels

Adjust your budget for more accurate financial reporting. Consider trends (or flukes) and how you might prepare in the future for them. Remember, your budget is a living document. If you’re doing things right, it will continually change as you make improvements.

Identify

Image by Noelle Otto under Pexels

Identify areas to increase income or cut expenses. We’ve covered many ways to boost revenue in our module on setting and collecting fees. Now, let’s look at a couple of ideas for reducing expenses:

  • Analyze Staffing: Consider completing a “Ratio Watch” by checking the Teacher-Student Ratio every hour of the day. There may be times of the day when your center is not at its maximum attendance, most commonly before and during morning drop-off, mid-day for centers with separate morning and afternoon classes, and late afternoon when parents are picking up their children. During these times, you may reassign staff or modify their schedules.
  • Shop Vendors Aggressively: Every two years or when contract renewals permit, get bids from qualified vendors, up to ten if you can. At a minimum, it will give you a much clearer picture of the market cost for the service or product provided by each of the vendors. It can be easy to get comfortable with a vendor and choose to settle, but this common occurrence can cost your program a lot of money. Note: the cheapest price does not always mean that you should choose that vendor. Some vendors cost more, and they’re worth it. Shopping vendors will give you the information you need to make your decisions.
  • Eliminate “Moot Vendors”: Are there any vendors that deliver a service you could do yourself? For example, consider how frequently you need a janitorial service to clean versus having staff perform some of the basic routine cleaning tasks each day. Think about optimizing the vendors you use by considering what you most need to outsource and what can be completed in-house.

Determine

Image by RDNE Stock project under Pexels

Determine if additional financing is needed and how much. Then, consider the best sources for that funding.
